title: Community-oriented Hotel/Hostel Complex ON THE MARKS Opens in Kawasaki near Tokyo, Providing BED, FOOD, and MUSIC [UDS Ltd.]
text:
Thumbnail August 06, 2015 12:00 PM   
TOKYO--( BUSINESS WIRE )--UDS Ltd. ( http://www.uds-net.co.jp ), responsible for the Hotel Claska and Hotel Anteroom Kyoto, announces the opening of a new hotel/hostel complex ON THE MARKS ( http://www.on-the-marks.jp ), specializing in tourist accommodations and planned, designed, and operated by UDS Ltd. in Kawasaki near Tokyo. 
Hotel Concept 
ON THE MARKS is a stopping point for all “hopping travelers”In recent years, more foreign tourists prefer to travel by “hopping” all over Japan and staying at various places rather than staying at one place for extended periods of time. We assume what those tourists want is not fancy facilities but safe and clean accommodation at a reasonable price with designs and services that allow guests to feel the identity of the area. 
The name ON THE MARKS means a place where guests can get themselves ready for a trip. We want to provide comfortable accommodation and enhance the quality of travel experience for our guests. 
Characteristics of Guest Rooms 
We offer three types of accommodation to meet various tourists’ needs: Bunk Bed, Compact Room, and Standard Room. Bunk Bed type pursues comfortable accommodation at a reasonable price (from 3,900 yen/person). Compact Room type provides private rooms for guests who value their privacy (from 5,800 yen/person). Standard Room type offers single and double private rooms equipped a bath or shower (from 8,000 yen/person). In the Bunk Bed and Compact Room types, women-only floors are available. 
Characteristics of Common Spaces 
At our dining space on the first floor, we offer food, drinks, and services that allow our guests to feel the connection to the community and identity of the area. 
Click here for details.（ http://www.on-the-marks.jp ） 
About HotelOpening date: September 16, 2015Number of guest rooms: 226 
UDS Ltd. plans, designs, and operates various real estates and architectures in Japan and abroad, including hotels, offices, commercial facilities, restaurants, and residential buildings.
